story:
EXPERIENCE THE JOURNEY

 LIVE THE ADVENTURE

 with WELLINGTON & CROMWELL

Please email us to arrange a live product demonstration and meet the Wellington & Cromwell project team in New York City.

THE WELLINGTON & CROMWELL ORIGIN STORY

I purchased a cool looking "Alibaba bag" on ebay for $40.  It was a copy of a Belstaff Colonial 554 (retail $385) that was worn by Will Smith in "I am Legend" and Christian Bale in "Batman Begins" but the quality of the "Alibaba bag" sucked.  The cotton canvas was cheap and thin and the "leather" looked like plastic.

But since I liked the style and utility of the bag, I looked for a way to reproduce it with the best materials and construction. I also made design improvements to the "Will Smith" bag, adding a zipper closure, a laptop computer compartment, pen and business card holders, and straps to hold an umbrella.  

I sourced expensive English bridle leather and 22oz cotton canvas from the British Millerain Mill and reconstructed the "Will Smith" bag.  I loved the finished product and to my surprise, the bag was still cheaper than a Designer Brand. (note: for a one off sample my production cost was three to four times the mass production price, which is the price for a minimum order of 500.  At this sample price, the bag was still 50% less than a Designer Brand using similar materials and construction.)

Alibaba bag (top) vs. Wellington & Cromwell Adventurer Satchel (bottom)


The best analogy I can make is this:

You can get a 1 carat Tiffany diamond engagement ring for $15,000. You can spec the same exact diamond, like testing in a laboratory chemically the same, on Bluenile for $7,500, or you can buy a cubic zirconia that looks similar to both the above for $25 on Amazon. The Alibaba bag is the cubic zirconia, my Wellington & Cromwell bag is the Bluenile, and a Designer Brand bag is the Tiffany in this analogy.  But its not a perfect analogy because Wellington & Cromwell bags use BETTER materials than most Designer Brands.

That's when I realized this could be a business opportunity and that there might be other people out there like me looking for high quality well made luxury goods offered at a fair price.  That's why I created Wellington & Cromwell.


I designed and developed a few more bags for my personal use and I received tons of compliments on the bags.  My business plan for Wellington & Cromwell is to charge somewhere between 2x and 3x my FOB (freight on board) price for each bag which would still make Wellington & Cromwell bags 33% to 66% less expensive than bags from comparable Designer Brands.

I am hoping there are people out there who believe in my vision of high quality luxury goods offered at a fair price.  If you do, please support the Wellington & Cromwell Indiegogo Campaign.

YOUR JOURNEY BEGINS...

My vision for the Wellington & Cromwell Project is to create the most beautiful, well-made, heirloom quality luxury goods at an accessible price point for travelers, adventurers, and explorers. 

Wellington & Cromwell creates moral and economic dignity for workers by paying them a fair wage for crafting a beautiful luxury good, and for consumers by offering a luxury good where the value is inherent in the ethical craftsmanship, not wasted in retail markups, celebrity endorsements, and high fashion marketing campaigns.

Our project's definition of quality considers three primary factors; design, materials, and craftsmanship. 

DESIGN

Wellington & Cromwell bags are inspired by the classic vintage military duffel bag and motorcycle messenger dispatch bag because so much of men's style is inspired by military functionality, e.g. aviator sunglasses, navy peacoats, cargo pants, M-65 field jackets, B-3 bomber leather jackets, etc.  Wellington & Cromwell bags are stylish and rugged, suitable for the office or for adventure.

MATERIALS

Wellington & Cromwell bags are crafted from the most suitable and authentic materials.  We use natural super heavy duty 24oz waxed cotton canvas and the two best grades of leather, natural full-grain and top-grain leather.  

We don't use genuine leather or bonded leather which is just scrap leather reconstituted into something resembling leather, like how meat slurry is made into chicken nuggets or "all beef" hamburger patties. We don't use nylon or other synthetic materials because they are inferior to natural materials except for certain specific applications, e.g. the corporate logo bags you get for free at job fairs.

CRAFTSMANSHIP

Wellington & Cromwell bags are crafted to the high standards equal to or above any other luxury product currently on the market, with the exception of truly artisanal brands like Hermes or Brunello Cucinelli.  The bags are crafted by experienced artisans working in a modern facility using the best tooling available.  Everything is double stitched, seams are reinforced, high quality treated brass hardware is used.

Wellington & Cromwell Proudly Introduces the 2015 Gentleman Explorer Club Collection

NOTE: All Wellington & Cromwell Bags will feature "Edward Wellington's Lucky Spanish Doubloon," the Antique Brass Treasure Coin as shown on the Leather Gentleman Explorer Club Travel Duffel


I.  The Wellington & Cromwell Adventurer Satchel

Inspired by WWII era motorcycle messenger dispatch bags, the Wellington & Cromwell Adventurer Satchel is functional and looks good, whether you're at a meeting at Skadden Arps or trekking through Angkor Wat. 

The Satchel is constructed in super heavy duty 24oz Gobi Desert waxed cotton canvas and finished with top grain leather.  It features three interior compartments and functional internal pockets for electronics. The Adventurer Satchel is the perfect everyday carry bag.

-24oz Gobi Desert waxed cotton canvas and top grain leather messenger bag/briefcase.

-main compartment has brass zipper closure

-treated brass hardware

-three interior compartments, pen holders, card holder, and two pockets for electronics 

-measures 16" x 12" x 5"

 II.  Wellington & Cromwell Explorer Duffel Bag

The Wellington & Cromwell Explorer Duffel is crafted from a classic vintage design. Its the perfect day trip carryall that is stylish enough for the city but able to withstand rugged use in the country. The full grain leather trim will develop a beautiful warm patina over time.

-24oz Gobi Desert waxed cotton canvas and full grain leather day trip duffel bag

-two-way brass zipper closure

-detachable and adjustable full grain leather shoulder strap

-treated brass hardware

-interior zipper pocket for documents

-metal feet protect bag bottom

-Measures 20" x 10" x 11"

 III.  Wellington & Cromwell Adventurer Duffel Bag

Rugged and handsome, the Wellington & Cromwell Adventurer Duffel says, "Gentleman Explorer and Adventurer" in a way a rolling Tumi or Samsonite never will. You might be going to an insurance salesman convention in Tampa but isn't it more fun to look like you're going to Nepal or Bhutan?

-24oz Gobi Desert waxed cotton canvas and full grain leather

-two-way brass zipper with snap-closure storm flap for protection

-full grain leather handles with two-snap grip.  

-detachable and adjustable full grain leather shoulder strap

-treated brass hardware  

-interior zipper pocket for documents

-metal feet protect bag bottom

-Long weekend trip size duffel bag. Measures 19" x 11" x 11"

 IV.  Wellington & Cromwell Gentleman Explorer Club Duffel Bag.

Crafted by experienced artisans from carefully selected calfskin hides that are vegetable-tanned to a deep, rich British Sable, the Wellington & Cromwell Gentleman Explorer Club Duffel Bag, "The Wellington" is the ultimate carryall. The rich full grain leather will develop a deep warm patina over time and with hard use. 

This bag will be a reliable companion on your epic journey from Manhattan to Brooklyn, on safari, rafting on the Amazon or climbing Nanga Parbat.

-Rugged and luxurious full-grain leather duffel bag

-Treated brass hardware

-Interior zipper pocket for documents

-Interior leather stowage straps with treated brass buckles to keep everything in place

-Metal feet protect bag bottom

V. Unique Indiegogo Backer Rewards

Finally, Wellington & Cromwell is proud to introduce two very special Indiegogo Backer rewards, Edward Wellington's Lucky Spanish Doubloon Pin and Henry Cromwell's Compass.

Edward Wellington's Lucky Spanish Doubloon Pin

This reward will be available to all Backers, even at the $1 level. We know it is a big commitment to back a stranger on Indiegogo so it was important for us to demonstrate a reciprocal commitment to our Backers and show our appreciation for your support, even $1 of support and sharing our Indiegogo video on Facebook and Twitter will help launch Wellington & Cromwell.    

We thought long and hard about an economically feasible reward for $1 that would still be fun and cool and we came up with the idea of turning the Wellington & Cromwell Logo into a wearable pin.

This pin is a treated brass replica of "Edward Wellington's Lucky Spanish Doubloon" affixed to all Wellington & Cromwell Bags. Its an Eight Escudo Coin belonging to Edward Wellington, long believed to have been lost during a drinking game in Siam. Recently found in the library of Cloudfall Manor in Scotland, nestled between the pages of a first edition of Around the World in 80 Days.

Henry Cromwell's Compass

For those special backers who become founding members of the Wellington & Cromwell Gentleman Explorer Club, we have a very special artifact reward, Henry Cromwell's Compass. 

 The 45mm diameter brass compass is engraved on the front with, "Not all those who wander are lost" a line from a poem in Lord of the Rings by JRR Tolkien. The backside is engraved "HCC" for Henry Cornelius Cromwell, the Legendary Gentleman Explorer to whom this compass once belonged.

We hope you will carry this treasure on your person as a daily reminder to take every opportunity to adventure, discover, and explore.

THE DESIGN PROCESS

I take the best features of expensive designer bags I own to create "Frankenbags."  Like Doctor Frankenstein, but with a bag, meaning that I mix parts, e.g. handles, shoulder straps, zippers, storm flaps, pockets, internal compartments, etc. of each designer bag like how Dr. Frankenstein stitched together different body parts to create his perfect monster.

I then work with the manufacturer to create paper patterns from which we cut the leather and canvas and stitch those pieces together to create a sample of the real bag.

We had four primary goals for the design of the Wellington & Cromwell logo which would be affixed to all our bags.

1. It had to be discreet, not too blingy, yet still be able to immediately communicate to the user quality, refinement, and authenticity.  From this we knew it had to be small enough to be subtle and difficult to counterfeit.

2. It couldn't be ridiculously expensive to fabricate but still had to meet the requirements in goal #1.

3. It had to fit with the overall theme of Wellington & Cromwell i.e. "gentleman explorers," adventure, exploration, travel, vintage, natural materials (not plastic)

4. It had to be more beautiful, fun, and cool than any logo currently in the marketplace.

We eventually settled on a treasure coin because it communicated all the things we wanted our logo to communicate:

1. looks valuable

2. small enough to be discreet (size of US quarter) yet visible enough

3. made of metal so its hard to counterfeit

4. its fun and cool because the coin evokes pirates and sunken treasure

5. The aged effect of the coin fits with the overall Wellington & Cromwell theme

The logo runners up in order were a nude mermaid, a horned owl, and a mallard duck

The design process is a bit of a misnomer because it takes hundreds of hours of collaboration between designer, developer, and manufacturing to bring a Wellington & Cromwell bag to life.

If we gave our designer free reign, he would specify that Wellington & Cromwell bags be made of dragonhide and unicorn horns.  Its the developer that is responsible for making sure that a design can actually be made into a physical object while still fully capturing the essence of the designer's creativity.

The developer then works with manufacturing to ensure that the product can be made consistently and efficiently.

This entire process at Wellington & Cromwell took thousands of hours of collaboration.  We hope you agree that the end result was a success.

MEET THE PROJECT CREATOR

I worked as an in house corporate attorney at the world's largest athletic footwear company in Asia for four years. I worked and lived in factory compounds in Taiwan, China, Vietnam, and Indonesia where I learned how things are made and developed expertise in Sustainable Manufacturing and Sourcing.  

From there I began dreaming of my own lifestyle brand that incorporated a Sustainable Manufacturing philosophy to create beautiful, well-made, heirloom quality luxury products at an accessible price point.  

I knew I would have to come up with an innovative business model because I didn't want to compromise on quality design, materials, and craftsmanship to compete on high volume margins but I also didn't want to be a ridiculously priced luxury brand.  

This concept developed into the Wellington & Cromwell project, which is a demonstration of how its possible to offer the best quality goods at a fair price. Wellington & Cromwell isn't cheap, but the price point is less than half that of lesser products currently on the market from prestigious luxury brands.  

I am hopeful that the Indiegogo Community will embrace this new business model.

FUNDING WELLINGTON & CROMWELL

Wellington & Cromwell has developed a relationship with an experienced manufacturer, allowing us to eliminate unnecessary costs while maintaining an accessible Indiegogo backer reward price.  We are allocating our backer funding towards the highest quality materials and ethical sustainable manufacturing and sourcing for Wellington & Cromwell products.

We are offering special Indiegogo backer reward pricing for this project but we want to emphasize that a Wellington & Cromwell bag is absolutely a high quality luxury product that is more than comparable in terms of design, materials, and craftsmanship to offerings from designer brands costing three times as much.  

We've tried to demonstrate the quality of a Wellington & Cromwell bag through video and photos but touching the full grained texture of the leather and smelling the natural leather is a whole different story.  Please email us to arrange a live product demonstration and meet the Wellington & Cromwell project team in New York City.

We hope to share the experience and journey of a Wellington & Cromwell bag with you.

Risks and challenges

The risks and challenges that are ahead of us as we finalize the development, production, and delivery of Wellington & Cromwell bags are related to logistics and the business model. We are confident that we have developed a well crafted, stylish, and rugged product.

I am a lawyer and not an MBA and there is the risk that I priced the rewards too low and may lose money on this project. Comparable products from designer brands are priced three times the price of Wellington & Cromwell bags but I wanted to set a reasonable price for a Indiegogo project so that any Indiegogo backer who wants a Wellington & Cromwell bag can have one.

Wellington & Cromwell is looking forward to engaging with the Indiegogo community and hearing your feedback!

Thank you for your interest in Wellington & Cromwell!
story_txt:
Wellington & Cromwell Adventurer Satchel
 EXPERIENCE THE JOURNEY

I'd advise against checking in your Wellington & Cromwell bags here.
 LIVE THE ADVENTURE

Sometimes you have to improvise....
 with WELLINGTON & CROMWELL

A Wellington & Cromwell bag is a call to adventure!
Please email us to arrange a live product demonstration and meet the Wellington & Cromwell project team in New York City.
THE WELLINGTON & CROMWELL ORIGIN STORY

I purchased a cool looking "Alibaba bag" on ebay for $40.  It was a copy of a Belstaff Colonial 554 (retail $385) that was worn by Will Smith in "I am Legend" and Christian Bale in "Batman Begins" but the quality of the "Alibaba bag" sucked.  The cotton canvas was cheap and thin and the "leather" looked like plastic.But since I liked the style and utility of the bag, I looked for a way to reproduce it with the best materials and construction. I also made design improvements to the "Will Smith" bag, adding a zipper closure, a laptop computer compartment, pen and business card holders, and straps to hold an umbrella.  
I sourced expensive English bridle leather and 22oz cotton canvas from the British Millerain Mill and reconstructed the "Will Smith" bag.  I loved the finished product and to my surprise, the bag was still cheaper than a Designer Brand. (note: for a one off sample my production cost was three to four times the mass production price, which is the price for a minimum order of 500.  At this sample price, the bag was still 50% less than a Designer Brand using similar materials and construction.)

Alibaba bag (top) vs. Wellington & Cromwell Adventurer Satchel (bottom)
The best analogy I can make is this:
You can get a 1 carat Tiffany diamond engagement ring for $15,000. You can spec the same exact diamond, like testing in a laboratory chemically the same, on Bluenile for $7,500, or you can buy a cubic zirconia that looks similar to both the above for $25 on Amazon. The Alibaba bag is the cubic zirconia, my Wellington & Cromwell bag is the Bluenile, and a Designer Brand bag is the Tiffany in this analogy.  But its not a perfect analogy because Wellington & Cromwell bags use BETTER materials than most Designer Brands.

That's when I realized this could be a business opportunity and that there might be other people out there like me looking for high quality well made luxury goods offered at a fair price.  That's why I created Wellington & Cromwell.


I designed and developed a few more bags for my personal use and I received tons of compliments on the bags.  My business plan for Wellington & Cromwell is to charge somewhere between 2x and 3x my FOB (freight on board) price for each bag which would still make Wellington & Cromwell bags 33% to 66% less expensive than bags from comparable Designer Brands.
I am hoping there are people out there who believe in my vision of high quality luxury goods offered at a fair price.  If you do, please support the Wellington & Cromwell Indiegogo Campaign.

YOUR JOURNEY BEGINS...
My vision for the Wellington & Cromwell Project is to create the most beautiful, well-made, heirloom quality luxury goods at an accessible price point for travelers, adventurers, and explorers. 
Wellington & Cromwell creates moral and economic dignity for workers by paying them a fair wage for crafting a beautiful luxury good, and for consumers by offering a luxury good where the value is inherent in the ethical craftsmanship, not wasted in retail markups, celebrity endorsements, and high fashion marketing campaigns.
Our project's definition of quality considers three primary factors; design, materials, and craftsmanship. 
DESIGN
Wellington & Cromwell bags are inspired by the classic vintage military duffel bag and motorcycle messenger dispatch bag because so much of men's style is inspired by military functionality, e.g. aviator sunglasses, navy peacoats, cargo pants, M-65 field jackets, B-3 bomber leather jackets, etc.  Wellington & Cromwell bags are stylish and rugged, suitable for the office or for adventure.
MATERIALS
Wellington & Cromwell bags are crafted from the most suitable and authentic materials.  We use natural super heavy duty 24oz waxed cotton canvas and the two best grades of leather, natural full-grain and top-grain leather.  
We don't use genuine leather or bonded leather which is just scrap leather reconstituted into something resembling leather, like how meat slurry is made into chicken nuggets or "all beef" hamburger patties. We don't use nylon or other synthetic materials because they are inferior to natural materials except for certain specific applications, e.g. the corporate logo bags you get for free at job fairs.
CRAFTSMANSHIP
Wellington & Cromwell bags are crafted to the high standards equal to or above any other luxury product currently on the market, with the exception of truly artisanal brands like Hermes or Brunello Cucinelli.  The bags are crafted by experienced artisans working in a modern facility using the best tooling available.  Everything is double stitched, seams are reinforced, high quality treated brass hardware is used.



Wellington & Cromwell Adventurer Duffel
Wellington & Cromwell Proudly Introduces the 2015 Gentleman Explorer Club Collection
NOTE: All Wellington & Cromwell Bags will feature "Edward Wellington's Lucky Spanish Doubloon," the Antique Brass Treasure Coin as shown on the Leather Gentleman Explorer Club Travel Duffel



I.  The Wellington & Cromwell Adventurer Satchel

So British!


Inspired by WWII era motorcycle messenger dispatch bags, the Wellington & Cromwell Adventurer Satchel is functional and looks good, whether you're at a meeting at Skadden Arps or trekking through Angkor Wat. 
The Satchel is constructed in super heavy duty 24oz Gobi Desert waxed cotton canvas and finished with top grain leather.  It features three interior compartments and functional internal pockets for electronics. The Adventurer Satchel is the perfect everyday carry bag.
-24oz Gobi Desert waxed cotton canvas and top grain leather messenger bag/briefcase.
-main compartment has brass zipper closure
-treated brass hardware
-three interior compartments, pen holders, card holder, and two pockets for electronics 
-measures 16" x 12" x 5"

Ready for work

Ready for action



Adventurer Satchel interior. Three compartments, pen holders, card holders, pockets for electronics
 II.  Wellington & Cromwell Explorer Duffel Bag

Vespa and Wellington & Cromwell, two classic examples of timeless vintage style


The Wellington & Cromwell Explorer Duffel is crafted from a classic vintage design. Its the perfect day trip carryall that is stylish enough for the city but able to withstand rugged use in the country. The full grain leather trim will develop a beautiful warm patina over time.
-24oz Gobi Desert waxed cotton canvas and full grain leather day trip duffel bag
-two-way brass zipper closure
-detachable and adjustable full grain leather shoulder strap
-treated brass hardware
-interior zipper pocket for documents
-metal feet protect bag bottom
-Measures 20" x 10" x 11"

Ready to explore the world

Packed and ready for the weekend!



Explorer Duffel Bag interior

Personalize your Explorer Duffel with iron on patches!
 III.  Wellington & Cromwell Adventurer Duffel Bag


Rugged and handsome, the Wellington & Cromwell Adventurer Duffel says, "Gentleman Explorer and Adventurer" in a way a rolling Tumi or Samsonite never will. You might be going to an insurance salesman convention in Tampa but isn't it more fun to look like you're going to Nepal or Bhutan?
-24oz Gobi Desert waxed cotton canvas and full grain leather
-two-way brass zipper with snap-closure storm flap for protection
-full grain leather handles with two-snap grip.  
-detachable and adjustable full grain leather shoulder strap
-treated brass hardware  
-interior zipper pocket for documents
-metal feet protect bag bottom
-Long weekend trip size duffel bag. Measures 19" x 11" x 11"

Ready for Adventure!



Adventurer Duffel Bag interior
 IV.  Wellington & Cromwell Gentleman Explorer Club Duffel Bag.



Rich full-grain leather duffel bag affixed with Edward Wellington's Lucky Spanish Doubloon


Crafted by experienced artisans from carefully selected calfskin hides that are vegetable-tanned to a deep, rich British Sable, the Wellington & Cromwell Gentleman Explorer Club Duffel Bag, "The Wellington" is the ultimate carryall. The rich full grain leather will develop a deep warm patina over time and with hard use. 
This bag will be a reliable companion on your epic journey from Manhattan to Brooklyn, on safari, rafting on the Amazon or climbing Nanga Parbat.
-Rugged and luxurious full-grain leather duffel bag
-Treated brass hardware
-Interior zipper pocket for documents
-Interior leather stowage straps with treated brass buckles to keep everything in place
-Metal feet protect bag bottom



bag interior with two adjustable leather stowage straps, note the reinforced gussets on the sides of the bag their function is to allow the bag to open wide when unzipped.




V. Unique Indiegogo Backer Rewards

Henry Cromwell's Compass and Edward Wellington's Lucky Spanish Doubloon Pin
Finally, Wellington & Cromwell is proud to introduce two very special Indiegogo Backer rewards, Edward Wellington's Lucky Spanish Doubloon Pin and Henry Cromwell's Compass.
Edward Wellington's Lucky Spanish Doubloon Pin

Edward Wellington's Lucky Spanish Doubloon worn as a lapel pin
This reward will be available to all Backers, even at the $1 level. We know it is a big commitment to back a stranger on Indiegogo so it was important for us to demonstrate a reciprocal commitment to our Backers and show our appreciation for your support, even $1 of support and sharing our Indiegogo video on Facebook and Twitter will help launch Wellington & Cromwell.    
We thought long and hard about an economically feasible reward for $1 that would still be fun and cool and we came up with the idea of turning the Wellington & Cromwell Logo into a wearable pin.
This pin is a treated brass replica of "Edward Wellington's Lucky Spanish Doubloon" affixed to all Wellington & Cromwell Bags. Its an Eight Escudo Coin belonging to Edward Wellington, long believed to have been lost during a drinking game in Siam. Recently found in the library of Cloudfall Manor in Scotland, nestled between the pages of a first edition of Around the World in 80 Days.

The Wellington & Cromwell logo was inspired by pirate treasure
Henry Cromwell's Compass


For those special backers who become founding members of the Wellington & Cromwell Gentleman Explorer Club, we have a very special artifact reward, Henry Cromwell's Compass. 
 The 45mm diameter brass compass is engraved on the front with, "Not all those who wander are lost" a line from a poem in Lord of the Rings by JRR Tolkien. The backside is engraved "HCC" for Henry Cornelius Cromwell, the Legendary Gentleman Explorer to whom this compass once belonged.
We hope you will carry this treasure on your person as a daily reminder to take every opportunity to adventure, discover, and explore.


THE DESIGN PROCESS
I take the best features of expensive designer bags I own to create "Frankenbags."  Like Doctor Frankenstein, but with a bag, meaning that I mix parts, e.g. handles, shoulder straps, zippers, storm flaps, pockets, internal compartments, etc. of each designer bag like how Dr. Frankenstein stitched together different body parts to create his perfect monster.
I then work with the manufacturer to create paper patterns from which we cut the leather and canvas and stitch those pieces together to create a sample of the real bag.

Logo design for metal molding
We had four primary goals for the design of the Wellington & Cromwell logo which would be affixed to all our bags.
1. It had to be discreet, not too blingy, yet still be able to immediately communicate to the user quality, refinement, and authenticity.  From this we knew it had to be small enough to be subtle and difficult to counterfeit.
2. It couldn't be ridiculously expensive to fabricate but still had to meet the requirements in goal #1.
3. It had to fit with the overall theme of Wellington & Cromwell i.e. "gentleman explorers," adventure, exploration, travel, vintage, natural materials (not plastic)
4. It had to be more beautiful, fun, and cool than any logo currently in the marketplace.
We eventually settled on a treasure coin because it communicated all the things we wanted our logo to communicate:
1. looks valuable
2. small enough to be discreet (size of US quarter) yet visible enough
3. made of metal so its hard to counterfeit
4. its fun and cool because the coin evokes pirates and sunken treasure
5. The aged effect of the coin fits with the overall Wellington & Cromwell theme
The logo runners up in order were a nude mermaid, a horned owl, and a mallard duck

early design sketch of the Adventurer Satchel
The design process is a bit of a misnomer because it takes hundreds of hours of collaboration between designer, developer, and manufacturing to bring a Wellington & Cromwell bag to life.
If we gave our designer free reign, he would specify that Wellington & Cromwell bags be made of dragonhide and unicorn horns.  Its the developer that is responsible for making sure that a design can actually be made into a physical object while still fully capturing the essence of the designer's creativity.
The developer then works with manufacturing to ensure that the product can be made consistently and efficiently.
This entire process at Wellington & Cromwell took thousands of hours of collaboration.  We hope you agree that the end result was a success.

early design sketch of the Adventurer Satchel and Adventurer Duffel incorporating our adventure and exploration theme

Our Designer and Developer had to agree on the perfect leather and waxed cotton canvas. This was a long process

The winner!

Developing a Tech Packet for manufacturing from a Design Sketch takes hundreds of Skype hours like the conversation you see here
MEET THE PROJECT CREATOR

Project Creator Edward Chang
I worked as an in house corporate attorney at the world's largest athletic footwear company in Asia for four years. I worked and lived in factory compounds in Taiwan, China, Vietnam, and Indonesia where I learned how things are made and developed expertise in Sustainable Manufacturing and Sourcing.  
From there I began dreaming of my own lifestyle brand that incorporated a Sustainable Manufacturing philosophy to create beautiful, well-made, heirloom quality luxury products at an accessible price point.  
I knew I would have to come up with an innovative business model because I didn't want to compromise on quality design, materials, and craftsmanship to compete on high volume margins but I also didn't want to be a ridiculously priced luxury brand.  
This concept developed into the Wellington & Cromwell project, which is a demonstration of how its possible to offer the best quality goods at a fair price. Wellington & Cromwell isn't cheap, but the price point is less than half that of lesser products currently on the market from prestigious luxury brands.  
I am hopeful that the Indiegogo Community will embrace this new business model.
FUNDING WELLINGTON & CROMWELL
Wellington & Cromwell has developed a relationship with an experienced manufacturer, allowing us to eliminate unnecessary costs while maintaining an accessible Indiegogo backer reward price.  We are allocating our backer funding towards the highest quality materials and ethical sustainable manufacturing and sourcing for Wellington & Cromwell products.
We are offering special Indiegogo backer reward pricing for this project but we want to emphasize that a Wellington & Cromwell bag is absolutely a high quality luxury product that is more than comparable in terms of design, materials, and craftsmanship to offerings from designer brands costing three times as much.  
We've tried to demonstrate the quality of a Wellington & Cromwell bag through video and photos but touching the full grained texture of the leather and smelling the natural leather is a whole different story.  Please email us to arrange a live product demonstration and meet the Wellington & Cromwell project team in New York City.
We hope to share the experience and journey of a Wellington & Cromwell bag with you.

artistic rendering of Edward Wellington, founding member of The Gentleman Explorer Club
Risks and challengesThe risks and challenges that are ahead of us as we finalize the development, production, and delivery of Wellington & Cromwell bags are related to logistics and the business model. We are confident that we have developed a well crafted, stylish, and rugged product.I am a lawyer and not an MBA and there is the risk that I priced the rewards too low and may lose money on this project. Comparable products from designer brands are priced three times the price of Wellington & Cromwell bags but I wanted to set a reasonable price for a Indiegogo project so that any Indiegogo backer who wants a Wellington & Cromwell bag can have one.Wellington & Cromwell is looking forward to engaging with the Indiegogo community and hearing your feedback!Thank you for your interest in Wellington & Cromwell!

story:
Stikk is a Unique Double Sided Gel Pad That Will Stick Anything to Everything! Stikk can be washed and Re-Used over 200 times! And it won't damage the surface you stick to! 

Our custom Gel recipe Makes Stikk the best all round Gel Adhesive pad on the market! Strong, sticky, durable, massively re-usable and washable, Stikk will change the way to store and stick everyday items! 

Facebook  - https://www.facebook.com/stikkgelpad

Webpage - http://www.stikkgel.com 


Stikk is a unique double sided thick core gel pad that will stick anything to everything! One single Stikk pad can safely hold any object up-to 350g (12.5oz), want to hold heavier items? Just use more Stikk Pads!

We found that finding ways of temporarily sticking objects to one another or other surfaces was an expensive and frustrating process and for the most part, the options were non-reusable, non-practical, looked bad and felt poor in quality or were simply not effective. 

So thats when it occurred, what we needed was a thin and re-useable small pad that will stick to a huge range of objects, materials and surfaces, without being expensive or ugly, and so Stikk was born. 

What we created in Stikk was the ultimate tool in sticking any small items to almost any surface. Stikk measures 7.6cm x 6.2cm x 0.3cm (3 Inches x 2.5 Inches x 0.1 Inches). Stikk is made from our own recipe of injection moulded Poly AB glue Plastic to create a material which is strong, flexible, sticky and re-usable, without being too hard, gluey or too soft like other similar products often are. Stikk can be pulled out to three to four times its size and it will return to its original size every-time. 

After several months of testing we came across a recipe that was the best all rounder. We found favouring some quantities against others did produce either a more durable but less sticky pad, or even a far stronger and sticky pad but far less durable and would last fewer uses. We found the best middle ground, a strong, durable, sticky pad that wasn't too much or too little of anything and was just right for everyday use! 

Stikk is very durable and can be cut into smaller pieces to create smaller gel pads for your smaller sticky needs!

How Stikk Works - The Special Stikk Recipe Explained:

Our unique recipe for Stikk involves a simple yet delicate process. The Stikk gel pad is classed as a Polyurethane Gel Elastomer. There are 5 distinct aspects when creating the recipe for Stikk that we had to test in different variables to arrive at the recipe we now have. They are: the Prepolymer material (the 'A' side) and what is called the Curative (the 'B' side) hence the A B glue recipe we mentioned earlier. The prepolymer consists of an isocyanate (or an NCO) that reacts with the hydroxyl (OH) in the curative, which creates the adhesive qualities. The final three aspects and variables are: component temperature, substrate temperature (temperature of the mixture) and post-curing temperature. All the five processes and variables, were tested in as many combinations as we could, to find the best all round gel pad recipe for Stikk. It is a particular combination of all five of those aspects that create Stikk. By applying particular quantities of the prepolymer and the curative at varying temperatures, we found many different styles of adhesive could be made, and so, this is how we eventually came across the recipe for Stikk. 

How Can You Use Stikk?

The great thing about Stikk is that you can use it to do almost anything. Stikk can help you in almost every area of your life. Keeping tidy at the office or at work, keeping objects sturdy in your car, holding your phone or tablet on a surface at home to watch a movie or use as a smart home hub, a key holder on your wall, the list is endless. But, to get you started here is some inspiration:

Sticking your phone to the outside of the shower to watch the news.

Office wall storage

Watching movies in the bath tub

Correcting paintings and wall hangings

Keeping rugs stable

Car phone holder

Can be cut to make smaller

Stick keys or cards or anything else to your phone

Attaching your phone or tablet to any surface to use a screen or face time at eye level.

Use Stikk to hold your cookbooks, smart tablet, or phones while cooking

Stick office equipment to your wall

Back seat screens for your passengers. 

A way to charge a phone when there is no surface area to hold it.

Stick things to your wall and don't leave any damage!

That doesn't even scratch the surface! The possibilities are endless! How will you use Stikk to transform your life? 

Using Stikk

Stikk is an all round great product for solving many everyday issues. Its also incredibly durable and will not damage your wall or car dash board! But as with most products, Stikk does have its limitations and we will explain these and tips on how you can avoid damaging your Stikk or objects and surfaces you use to Stikk with.

Sticking & Removing Stikk from an object or Surface

 To avoid damage to the object and surface that you are sticking to, and to make sure your Stikk pad lasts a long time, we advise using a Twist Then Pull method, as seen in our video. This will reduce the chances of the unlikely event your Stikk pad may damage a surface, object or itself.

Temperature

Stikk works great in almost all temperates, high or low without changing the way it sticks. We do however advise that you reduce usage in extreme temperatures either low or high. For example we would advise that you DO NOT use stick in temperatures bellow -16C (0F) or above 62C (150F). What this means is that Stikk will work in your hot car out in the sun in MOST PLACES in the world and will work outdoors in the cold in MOST cold places. But we advise you use caution in extreme temperatures. Stikk will not melt in high temperatures, but its effectiveness may change.

Weight 

While Stikk is very strong and very durable, we advise caution when using stick. You must use common sense. If you are wanting to stick an iPad or Tablet to a wall for example to watch a film, 1 Stikk pad should hold up with no issues. But using two Stikk pads will ensure security and strength. Environmental situations can play a part in the effectiveness of a Stikk pad. If you live in a hot humid place for example, the surface may be more moist than you think, which will reduce the power of Stikk, so we would advise using two pads, especially on a larger object.    

Surfaces

As a rule of thumb, the smoother and shinier the surface, the better Stikk with hold. Stikk can be very strong on some surfaces while on others it can be very weak, again we advise you use common sense to avoid injury and damage to the objects and surfaces on which you want to hold. 

Cleaning

 The great thing about Stikk is that it is re-useable. But evertime Stikk is removed and re-used it can lose its stickiness and get dirty as dust, dirt and other contaminants get stuck to it. But all you have to do to get your Stikk Gel pad back to its glory is rinse it under warm water. Just run some warm water and hold the Stikk pad under the stream while lightly massaging it, this will help remove and stubborn dirt and dust. Then, once clean, simply leave to air dry on the top of the tap. We suggest not using a towel or drying the washed Stikk pad in anyway other than air drying, to make sure that it regains its strength.

We stress that unless Stikk is washed regularly after being removed from surfaces, Stikk will eventually lose its sticky characteristics due to dust and dirt build up. To avoid this, be sure to wash your Stikk pad(s) regularly to avoid damage and ensure a long life. We also stress that although Stikk can safely hold 350g objects, these figures are found in ideal household conditions. If you are using expensive items, we suggest using two or more Stikk pads, just incase the surface you are sticking to is less than ideal, this will help to reduce the risk of the unlikely occurrence of Stikk coming loose. 

Should you have any issues or concerns after receiving your Stikk pad, we will be happy to hear them, to both, make sure you have a perfect experience using Stikk and so that we can work on any and all short comings (not that there are any ;) that we may have missed during the testing process for our recipe. We are confident that you will all have a great experience with Stikk, but we are here to help should any issues arise. 

We hope you enjoy the idea and uses for Stikk Gel pads and will want to join us on our mission to make them a reality. If you have any questions, just leave them in the comments section so everyone can see and we will make sure to get back to you as soon as we can. 

Thank You all for the support. 

Stikk 

PRESS CONTACT: contact@plus8group.com

Disclaimer: Use Stikk with common sense. Do not overload Stikk or use it with heavy objects. The heavier the object, or the more expensive or precious the object, the more Stikk pads you should use to safely hold your object to the surface. Use common sense and judgement when choosing a surface to stick your Stikk pad too, not all surfaces will have the same strength capabilities as others and the same goes with materials of the objects you want to stick. Stick, Plus 8 and any related persons or groups are not liable in anyway for any damage to your belongings, surfaces or self when using Stikk. 

Returns: Should you receive your Stikk Pad in less than perfect condition, you may contact us for a free replacement. We will be happy to work with all of our backers to resolve any and all issues that they have, should any arise. However, Since this is a crowdfunding campaign and we are offering Stikk as a pre-order in the form of a reward for your financial contribution rather than as a retail item, we do not have a return policy, we cannot give returns or refunds due to change of mind, misuse, damaged items due to misuse or damage to products used with Stikk or any other reason other than your Stikk arriving in a condition that will prevent you from using it. We believe that none of our customers will have issues with Stikk, but we are here to help at the best of our ability should you need any support at all! 

INSTAGRAM - COMING SOON

Back seat screens for your passengers. 
A way to charge a phone when there is no surface area to hold it.






















Stick things to your wall and don't leave any damage!
That doesn't even scratch the surface! The possibilities are endless! How will you use Stikk to transform your life? 
Using Stikk
Stikk is an all round great product for solving many everyday issues. Its also incredibly durable and will not damage your wall or car dash board! But as with most products, Stikk does have its limitations and we will explain these and tips on how you can avoid damaging your Stikk or objects and surfaces you use to Stikk with.
Sticking & Removing Stikk from an object or Surface
 To avoid damage to the object and surface that you are sticking to, and to make sure your Stikk pad lasts a long time, we advise using a Twist Then Pull method, as seen in our video. This will reduce the chances of the unlikely event your Stikk pad may damage a surface, object or itself.
Temperature
Stikk works great in almost all temperates, high or low without changing the way it sticks. We do however advise that you reduce usage in extreme temperatures either low or high. For example we would advise that you DO NOT use stick in temperatures bellow -16C (0F) or above 62C (150F). What this means is that Stikk will work in your hot car out in the sun in MOST PLACES in the world and will work outdoors in the cold in MOST cold places. But we advise you use caution in extreme temperatures. Stikk will not melt in high temperatures, but its effectiveness may change.
Weight 
While Stikk is very strong and very durable, we advise caution when using stick. You must use common sense. If you are wanting to stick an iPad or Tablet to a wall for example to watch a film, 1 Stikk pad should hold up with no issues. But using two Stikk pads will ensure security and strength. Environmental situations can play a part in the effectiveness of a Stikk pad. If you live in a hot humid place for example, the surface may be more moist than you think, which will reduce the power of Stikk, so we would advise using two pads, especially on a larger object.    
Surfaces
As a rule of thumb, the smoother and shinier the surface, the better Stikk with hold. Stikk can be very strong on some surfaces while on others it can be very weak, again we advise you use common sense to avoid injury and damage to the objects and surfaces on which you want to hold. 
Cleaning
 The great thing about Stikk is that it is re-useable. But evertime Stikk is removed and re-used it can lose its stickiness and get dirty as dust, dirt and other contaminants get stuck to it. But all you have to do to get your Stikk Gel pad back to its glory is rinse it under warm water. Just run some warm water and hold the Stikk pad under the stream while lightly massaging it, this will help remove and stubborn dirt and dust. Then, once clean, simply leave to air dry on the top of the tap. We suggest not using a towel or drying the washed Stikk pad in anyway other than air drying, to make sure that it regains its strength.


We stress that unless Stikk is washed regularly after being removed from surfaces, Stikk will eventually lose its sticky characteristics due to dust and dirt build up. To avoid this, be sure to wash your Stikk pad(s) regularly to avoid damage and ensure a long life. We also stress that although Stikk can safely hold 350g objects, these figures are found in ideal household conditions. If you are using expensive items, we suggest using two or more Stikk pads, just incase the surface you are sticking to is less than ideal, this will help to reduce the risk of the unlikely occurrence of Stikk coming loose. 
Should you have any issues or concerns after receiving your Stikk pad, we will be happy to hear them, to both, make sure you have a perfect experience using Stikk and so that we can work on any and all short comings (not that there are any ;) that we may have missed during the testing process for our recipe. We are confident that you will all have a great experience with Stikk, but we are here to help should any issues arise. 


We hope you enjoy the idea and uses for Stikk Gel pads and will want to join us on our mission to make them a reality. If you have any questions, just leave them in the comments section so everyone can see and we will make sure to get back to you as soon as we can. 
Thank You all for the support. 
Stikk 
PRESS CONTACT: contact@plus8group.com


Disclaimer: Use Stikk with common sense. Do not overload Stikk or use it with heavy objects. The heavier the object, or the more expensive or precious the object, the more Stikk pads you should use to safely hold your object to the surface. Use common sense and judgement when choosing a surface to stick your Stikk pad too, not all surfaces will have the same strength capabilities as others and the same goes with materials of the objects you want to stick. Stick, Plus 8 and any related persons or groups are not liable in anyway for any damage to your belongings, surfaces or self when using Stikk. 
Returns: Should you receive your Stikk Pad in less than perfect condition, you may contact us for a free replacement. We will be happy to work with all of our backers to resolve any and all issues that they have, should any arise. However, Since this is a crowdfunding campaign and we are offering Stikk as a pre-order in the form of a reward for your financial contribution rather than as a retail item, we do not have a return policy, we cannot give returns or refunds due to change of mind, misuse, damaged items due to misuse or damage to products used with Stikk or any other reason other than your Stikk arriving in a condition that will prevent you from using it. We believe that none of our customers will have issues with Stikk, but we are here to help at the best of our ability should you need any support at all! 
INSTAGRAM - COMING SOON

story:
Who the heck are we??

Frankie's Box is an original subscription box based out of Los Angeles, that strives to give personal, handpicked, secondhand clothing to customers who focus on trend and recycled alternatives. The online brand is a combination of a service, product, and a retailer. It is a thrifted, environmentally friendly, recycled, customized clothing box. 


Where did you come up with this brilliant idea??


Frankie's Box is loyal to being environmentally sustainable. From the merchandise to the box itself, the company promotes reused clothing and saving the environment. According to Marketing Charts, 83% of consumers say that it is important that companies implement programs to improve the environment. Not only this, but 83% of consumers believe that manufacturers using recycled packaging and producing energy efficient products have a positive impact on the environment. This being said, Frankie's Box will attract the eyes of 83% of consumers. The future potential of this company can only increase. People aren’t going to lose interest in the environment, they are only going to grow more involved in helping it piece itself back together. 

The Process...

Once you sign up for the clothing box online, you are immediately asked to fill in a few questions that lead one of our personal stylists to your exact style. Not only this, but the customer will be able to pick out a category of style from the different images of outfits that are displayed on the website.

 After this process, a personal stylist will pick out 5 items from our thrifted collection that best fit the customer's style, and then ship them off. Each of the clothing items are affordable even with the 50% mark up from the original thrift store price. 

A few things you should know about us that makes us a hot shot:

  • We are the first re-used clothing box
  • Our stylists physically go to the thrift stores to hand pick a large collection of trending items that will be used for our customers box
  •  The subscription is an option, you can either commit to monthly subscriptions, or a one time option.

 Another part of our process is that the customer will pay a $30.00 styling fee when they first order the box, this is to make sure we earn profit. This fee cancels out if the customer makes a purchase. Once they receive their box, they have 3 days to either return the items they don’t want to keep, purchase certain items or all of the items in the box, and if they fail to do so, they will be charged the full total of the merchandise in the box. They are given a return label, which makes this as easy as possible for them. If items are returned, we will reuse those items for a different box that matches another customer's style. 

Like any project, there are risks and challenges associated with starting a company. We’re working with our customers one on one and personally picking out items that fit the needs and wants of our client. That said, there is always a chance that unexpected changes or issues may arise during execution of the boxes. If we are off schedule we will always relay this information to our customers personally but we hope that we don't run into these issues.


How the funds will be implemented...

Frankie's Box will be using the funds from you lovely people strictly for supplies. Supplies includes the actual merchandise since we will need a secure inventory to give our customers what they deserve. Everything else is all ready to go! 

Our team is sincerely thankful for all the help we recieve from this campaign. We truly believe we can change the world while changing your closet, both for the best. 

Thank you!

Frankie's Box.

story:
Aerogram is a new brand based in Milan with a mission to pursue refined craftsmanship.

We haven’t reinvented anything. We’re just going back to basics. Handpicking natural materials that feel great and last a lifetime. We have gathered together an elite selection of artisans blessed with skill and passion. We bring these elements together with timeless, functional designs for a life well-lived on the move.

This is a flexible funding campaign. We guarantee the production of all the orders made during the course of this campaign, regardless of the end result.

The most beautiful things in life are also the most natural. Why should leather be any different?

We went to Tuscany to handpick two types of totally unprocessed leather. No chemicals, no chrome, no plastic coating, no spray-painting, no printing whatsoever. Just beautiful leather made completely respecting the traditions of the artisans of time gone by, using only botanic tannins for the most natural feeling ever.

Then we gathered together a unique collective of our fellow artisans in Milan to remind the world why Italians do it better.

The result is the ‘The Black Collection’. Five timeless pieces built to last a lifetime. Handmade in Italy to the highest quality standards, respecting the tradition of real Italian artisans. Ideal for a life well-lived on the move.

As a result of the organic nature of our leather, no two products can ever be the same. The leather is dry-spun in wooden tanning drums to make it shrink and create an extremely irregular grain, leaving it unique and natural to the touch. You will realise this as soon as hold it in your hand. Each piece is truly one of a kind.

ROVER | ALL-LEATHER RUCKSACK

€340 EARLY BIRD / €390 INDIEGOGO / €490 RETAIL

Rover is not a rucksack that you have to handle with care. You can rough it up, throw it on the ground and fill it to the brim. It will be your companion on thousands of adventures, from day to day life and travels to faraway places. It’s crying out to be used! It will pay you back with charm that only comes with the noblest natural leathers.

Rover has a unique personality. The material sensations of the leather combine charm and strength. Its pitch-black colour comes with a large central snap-hook and functional design. Rover is rugged and refined. It can be rolled or opened out completely to take advantage of its considerable capacity.

Details
Handmade in Milan, Italy.
100% Full-grain vegetable-tanned leather with mimosa and tree barks from Tuscany.
High quality Italian gunmetal hardware for maximum durability.

Exterior
Two-way gunmetal zip.
Front Snap-hook in gunmetal zamak.
Two side pockets.
One front pocket.
Adjustable shoulder straps, padded for maximum comfort.

Interior
Internal computer pocket (up to 13”).
Three internal pockets for glasses, a hard disk, copybook, etc.
1 snap-hook for keys and other accessories.
Drill Lining in 100% black cotton.

Measurements
Height: 41cm/ 16,14" (rolled) - 49cm/ 19,29" (opened out)
Width: 36cm/ 14,17"
Thickness: 14cm/ 5,51"
Capacity: 25L

THE GOOD BELT | THE ONE-PIECE BELT

€65 EARLY BIRD / €75 INDIEGOGO / €89 RETAIL

From a timeless design, the Good Belt is created from a unique piece of full-grain leather, about 4mm thick. The four stitches are handmade, the pitch-black rib and  the gunmetal buckle give the belt a rugged feel while maintaining a refined touch.

Details
Handmade in Milan, Italy.
Full-grain vegetable-tanned leather with mimosa and tree barks from Tuscany.
4 handmade stitches.
Hand-painted edges.
High quality Italian gunmetal buckle for maximum durability.
Waxed on the inside.
Discreet logo on the inside.
Thickness ~ 4mm/ 0,15”.

EL FLACO | SLIM LEATHER WALLET

€40 EARLY BIRD / €59 INDIEGOGO / €79 RETAIL



El Flaco is our ace in the hole. Light as a feather, elegant and ready to carry your cash and cards without adding any bulk. It will be an absolute pleasure to have it in your pocket and NOT feel it at all.

Details
Contains 6/7 cards and folded banknotes.
Handmade in Milan, Italy.
Full-grain vegetable-tanned leather with mimosa and tree barks from Tuscany.
2 vertical pockets for more frequently used cards.
The horizontal pocket contains 4/5 cards.
Unstitched winglets to allow for easy removal and insertion of banknotes.
Perfect for Euro, Dollar, Sterling and the majority of currencies.
Hand-painted edges.
Extra-resistant thread for lasting product life.
Embossed internal logo.

Measurements
Ultra slim: only 0,4cm/ 0.17" thick.
Dimension: 8cm X 10cm/ 3.14" X 3.93".
Super lightweight: 35gm/ 1.23oz.

TUTTO | LEATHER CARD HOLDER

€50 EARLY BIRD / €59 INDIEGOGO / €79 RETAIL

Tutto holds 6-10 cards, banknotes, business cards and receipts. The ultra-thin, refined design is perfect for the person looking for minimum clutter without sacrificing style.

Details
Contains 6/10 cards and folded banknotes, business cards and receipts.
Handmade in Milan, Italy.
Full-grain vegetable-tanned leather with mimosa and tree barks from Tuscany.

Measurements
Ultra slim: only 0,1cm/ 0.03" thick.
Dimension: 10cm X 8,5cm/ 3.9" X 3.3".
Super lightweight: 20gm/ 0.7oz.

TANDEM (2-PACK) | EARBUD ORGANIZER

€20 EARLY BIRD / €24 INDIEGOGO / €30 RETAIL

With Tandem your earbuds will always be organised and ready to use. The double clasp opens and closes in the blink of an eye and it studied to avoid the classic tangling of the earbuds.

Details
The set includes two tandems.
Handmade in Milan, Italy.
Full-grain vegetable-tanned leather with mimosa and tree barks from Tuscany.
High quality Italian gunmetal hardware for maximum durability.
Discreet logo on the inside.

BUNDLE N.1 | SMALL LEATHER GOODS

€160 EARLY BIRD / €185 INDIEGOGO / €262 RETAIL

It includes:
1 X The Good Belt
1 X El Flaco | Slim Leather Wallet
1 X Tutto | Leather Card Holder
1 X Tandem | Earbud Organizer

BUNDLE N.2 | FULL COLLECTION

€465 EARLY BIRD / €540 INDIEGOGO / €750 RETAIL

It includes:
1 X Rover | All-Leather Rucksack
1 X The Good Belt
1 X El Flaco | Slim Leather Wallet
1 X Tutto | Leather Card Holder
1 X Tandem | Earbud Organizer

We believe in provenance. It’s not really what we do, but how we do it. All our products are accompanied by the Provenance Record.

You will know the artisan that created your product and the materials used. This absolute transparency is our true pride.

You are purchasing an authentic item that has been made by an artisan with passion just for you.

OUR LEATHER

The Tannery

Refined, rugged, lasting, natural, voluptuous. These are the words that come to mind as soon as you hold the leather from the Ausonia Tannery.

Based in Santa Croce (50KM from the city of Florence, Tuscany), Ausonia is among the few tanneries that keep the vegetable tanning tradition alive. They use secret recipes for the production process based on botanic extracts of mimosa and the barks of the chestnut and quebracho trees.

The two types of leather we picked are tanned in bottale (a traditional Tuscan wooden leather tanning drum) with an irregular grained surface for a completely natural sensation to touch. They are both full grain. Due to the organic nature of the tanning process no two products can ever be the same. Every item will have its own character and individuality.

Vegetable Tanning

Unlike the leather tanned using chrome and chemical substances (90% of the leather in the world) that requires only one day of production, vegetable tanning is a lengthy and lavish artisanal process. You need 4-5 weeks to transform the highest quality raw materials sourced in France into the finished product.

All this work is repaid by an extraordinary leather that not only stands the test of time, but also becomes more beautiful everyday, developing its own unique patina, telling the story of the whoever uses it.

Sustainability

The Ausonia hides were tested by the “Experimental Station for the Leather and tanned material industry.” After conducting the necessary analyses on the hides, it was certified that only organic substances were used, without the use of dangerous chemical products and metals (chrome, aluminium, titanium, zircon).

As we said before, the most beautiful things in life are also the most natural.

HANDMADE IN MILAN, ITALY

Italian leather artisans are quite reserved. They hide away in secret workshops where they can work without distractions. Luckily for us we are quite good at tracking down these elusive men and women. Luckily also for you too because all our products are made by hand in the small workshops of these master artisans.

The ancient production process gives the product a precious added value, and makes it more elegant and resistant to cope with even the most intense uses.

Mr. Mario's Workshop

A lifetime spent between workshops in Rome and Milan. Mario specialises in belts and small leather goods. Today he shares the workshop with his son.

Mr. Davide's Workshop

The second generation has arrived. Davide manages the workshop together with his brother. Their specialities are rucksacks, bags and travel bags.

The Aerogram products are built to last a lifetime and come with a three-year guarantee. We offer free repairs during this time and we substitute products that come with material or production defects.

For our initial launch we have decided to limit shipping to the European Union as well as USA, Canada and Switzerland. Please be aware that our backers from The United States, Canada and Switzerland could be asked to pay custom fees.

For our customers in USA, Canada, and Switzerland: normally we don’t ship outside the EU, so this is a really unique occasion to purchase an Aerogram product.

Each item in the Black Collection is made individually in small workshops. The production capacity is obviously limited and nowhere near the numbers of mass industrial production. For this reason we have established two delivery timeframes. The first production batch will be for the first 300 orders, the second batch will be for all remaining orders. Hurry up! First come, first served.

September 21st - October 19th
Indiegogo Campaigning.

October 20th - November 8th
Sourcing materials.

November 9th - November 30th
Production of the first 300 pieces.

December 1st
Begin shipping the first 300 orders (in time for Christmas).

January 2017
Shipping remaining orders.

My name is Andrea Mignolo and I am the founder of Aerogram.

Aerogram is project born out of the experience of Blinking City, a creative production study in Milan. Blinking City creates original connections between brands, people and places, told through photos, videos and texts. The co-founder of Blinking City Gianluca Giannone is our Head of Photography. The rest of the team is made up of people with years of experience in the leather goods and luxury clothing goods industry.

You can contact us at anytime at the following address hello[at]aerogramco.com.

If you would like to find out more about Blinking City please visit our website.


We feel absolutely confident that we can deliver this product on schedule.

Our team has lots of experience in the production of high-quality artisanal products. We have a close working relationship with the producers of the leather as well as the artisans who create our products. The production is carried out here in Milan. The artisans are located nearby our studios. This allows us to work closely with them and quickly overcome any problems that may arise.

All this work is repaid by an extraordinary leather that not only stands the test of time, but also becomes more beautiful everyday, developing its own unique patina, telling the story of the whoever uses it.
Sustainability
The Ausonia hides were tested by the “Experimental Station for the Leather and tanned material industry.” After conducting the necessary analyses on the hides, it was certified that only organic substances were used, without the use of dangerous chemical products and metals (chrome, aluminium, titanium, zircon).
As we said before, the most beautiful things in life are also the most natural.

HANDMADE IN MILAN, ITALY

Italian leather artisans are quite reserved. They hide away in secret workshops where they can work without distractions. Luckily for us we are quite good at tracking down these elusive men and women. Luckily also for you too because all our products are made by hand in the small workshops of these master artisans.
The ancient production process gives the product a precious added value, and makes it more elegant and resistant to cope with even the most intense uses. 


Mr. Mario's Workshop
A lifetime spent between workshops in Rome and Milan. Mario specialises in belts and small leather goods. Today he shares the workshop with his son.


Mr. Davide's Workshop
The second generation has arrived. Davide manages the workshop together with his brother. Their specialities are rucksacks, bags and travel bags. 
The Aerogram products are built to last a lifetime and come with a three-year guarantee.  We offer free repairs during this time and we substitute products that come with material or production defects.

For our initial launch we have decided to limit shipping to the European Union as well as USA, Canada and Switzerland. Please be aware that our backers from The United States, Canada and Switzerland could be asked to pay custom fees.
For our customers in USA, Canada, and Switzerland: normally we don’t ship outside the EU, so this is a really unique occasion to purchase an Aerogram product.
Each item in the Black Collection is made individually in small workshops. The production capacity is obviously limited and nowhere near the numbers of mass industrial production. For this reason we have established two delivery timeframes. The first production batch will be for the first 300 orders, the second batch will be for all remaining orders. Hurry up! First come, first served.
September 21st - October 19th
Indiegogo Campaigning.
October 20th - November 8th
Sourcing materials.
November 9th - November 30th
Production of the first 300 pieces.
December 1st 
Begin shipping the first 300 orders (in time for Christmas).
January 2017
Shipping remaining orders.

My name is Andrea Mignolo and I am the founder of Aerogram.
Aerogram is project born out of the experience of Blinking City, a creative production study in Milan. Blinking City creates original connections between brands, people and places, told through photos, videos and texts. The co-founder of Blinking City Gianluca Giannone is our Head of Photography. The rest of the team is made up of people with years of experience in the leather goods and luxury clothing goods industry. 
You can contact us at anytime at the following address hello[at]aerogramco.com.
If you would like to find out more about Blinking City please visit our website.
We feel absolutely confident  that we can deliver this product on schedule.
Our team has lots of experience in the production of high-quality artisanal products. We have a close working relationship with the producers of the leather as well as the artisans who create our products. The production is carried out here in Milan. The artisans are located nearby our studios. This allows us to work closely with them and quickly overcome any problems that may arise.

story:
I am a single mum with a passion for creativity.

Previously I designed and make latex outfits, namely cosplay and geekery based creations along with the odd pinup and fashion piece.

My passion is really in sewing and craftwork though. I've always made things, always had the need to keep active with my hands and I have a dream that one day I will be able to support myself and my son through a business based on my crafts and designs.

Your donations would help me begin to realise that dream and would allow me to begin holding stock, investing in higher quality fabrics as well as producing my own designs on fabric. In addition I can begin to seriously look at taking further courses allowing me to study fabric and vehicle reupholstery.

I would also like to invest in proper tags, washing, and care instructions for the clothing and toys that I make.

I am asking for £700 to help fund me in buying unique, vintage and different fabrics as well as a second hand overlocking machine which would help me to take my finishing to a much more professional level.

If I don't reach my goal, I will invest anything I do make into supplies and sundries to keep my little business growing.

I have lots of examples of the things I make on my facebook page, http://www.facebook.com/thepatchworkmonkey. I thank you in advance for any donations that I receive.  Any one kind enough to make a donation will receive a personal thank you on a dedicated page of my website

story:
Making the world a brighter place, one photograph and Design at a time.

Young photographer/ Graphic artist serving New Hampshire's seacoast area.


I became interested in Art and Photography at a very young age. I've always viewed the world in a creative light, stretching my imagination beyond the limits of reality. I feel a passionate desire to share my views with the world, to show them life through my eyes, a life which so inspires me to create. Through Photography and Graphic design, I can permanently capture the beauty of the world around me and cherish it for years to come. I can share it and put that beauty on display for people everywhere to enjoy. 

It's more than just photographing what I see. It's bringing my creative visions to life. It's documenting the wonderful happenings of the world. I find beauty in everything around me, from the flowers to the insects that crawl upon them. There's beauty in the earth and in the sky above us. Beauty is in the forests, the oceans, and the urban city. Beauty is people and all the glorious things that make us unique. 

Art is my passion and I feel it is my duty to share it with you. Through my camera lens, I can capture and express the charm and the elegance of people and things everywhere. Given the opportunity, we can help make the world a brighter place.

Project description:

My goal is to run a fully functioning photography and graphic design business. I want to be able to give life to my ideas, while also offering low-cost,  professional services. I want to be able to give people opportunities and benefits that might normally be  out of their price range. Once my business has enough profits and exposure, I plan to open a line of custom apparel and accessories. I dream of sharing my creations with people in a fun and useful way. My custom designs will be printed on a variety of clothing and accessories, ranging from T-shirts, to hats, to phone cases and more. I will also  be selling prints of most original art pieces, with various sizes available to purchase. 

I believe that businesses should be for the people, not for personal gain or greed. With an investment, I will be able to purchase all the equipment necessary to offer the public a professional and,  more importantly, affordable experience. With wages so low and the cost of living so high, I want people to know they can still afford to have the nice things they've always wanted. I'll be able to give a single mother beautiful portraits of her newborn baby without having to worry about cost. I can offer children functional and fashionable clothing, with allowance money left over. I can give people the products and services they deserve, and they can help support local artists and businesses. 

Artistry is about more than the singular - it's about an entire community. I'm proud to say that I am a part of a much larger, much more diverse community of talented artists, gifted in their trades and talents. Community means helping and supporting one another. Once my business is making profits, I plan to give back to my fellow artists and community members by donating time and money to help those in need. 

Your investment will provide me with the tools and equipment I need to be able to offer material happiness to the wonderful people in our worldwide  community.

Risks and Challenges:

Challenges I could face with this project are: Delay in manufacturing the products, Shipping mishaps, Getting new products into stores for resale, Advertisement and awareness of my business and products. To keep these things from ever being a problem or threat to the business I have put many things in order and on stand by already. 

Delay in manufacturing, can simply be avoided by making sure everything is thoroughly gone through, revised and having all design material in order, Along with good communication skills between myself and the manufacturer.

Shipping mishaps, Can be avoided by simply taking the time to make sure every clients information is correct and keeping clear records of that for such purposes, along with never rushing an order. Always plan ahead and make sure everything is done on time if not in advance.

 Getting new products into stores for resale, Some may say this is a tricky process. I have already set up a few local shops that are willing to take in products under contract for repurchase, Along with discussing matter with two sales representatives that are on stand by waiting to contact future stores and send a online catalog of products. to avoid any further problems with this, it is best that I take the time to put together a well organized online catalog. Such catalog will be shown on the main webpage. Advertisement and public awareness of my business. I have business cards on me at all times, along with example pieces of my work and all contact information for new clients. I volunteer doing the photography for a group of musicians and artists in my local area, were we raffle things off and I personally display my work every Tuesday night for the community to see. Besides having great connections to the community already to publicize my business, I have many social media accounts I keep up with everyday broadcasting my products and designs, along with my photography world wide.

Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram, my webpage, Some links I have provided for you to follow. Please feel free to familiarize yourselves with my work and growing business before any decisions are made.

 Over all I have already taken many safety precautions in protecting my growing business and insuring that it will be able to continue to grow, And i'm prepared to have to make many more difficult decisions in order to keep my business prosperous.

Not quite convinced? To Look further into my growing business please feel free to visit my new webpage with the most recent updated work of yours truly. dbgraphics21.webs.com

story:
GOOD NEWS!!! The COT online shop is now open!  

You can now order our internationally-designed, ethically-sourced, 100% organic cotton shirts HERE.

Thanks so much to our early supporters. We didn't reach our goal but that doesn't mean we gave up. We've learned so much from your input from this campaign, and because of that we've redesigned our website, restructured our business model, and ultimately made it so that it's easier to be a part of the collective impact we're aiming to make.  

Stay connected,

The COT Team

*****************

COT is a social venture that connects global artists, designers, organic cotton producers and farmers to create ethical fashion apparel for the world citizen. We’ve created 8 vibrant T-shirts designed by 7 international artists with eco-friendly manufacturers in Turkey who source their cotton from organic cotton farms, so that we can make a global impact on the fashion industry!










All apparel is certified by the Global Organic Textiles Standard (GOTS).

This means:

  • Made of 100% non-GMO organic cotton from Turkey
  • All companies from cotton to clothing are certified and traceable in Turkey
  • Dyes are water-based, non-toxic, and non-metallic
  • All facilities treat their wastewater properly
  • No slave or child labor
  • Fair living wages for workers

We visited the farmers in western Turkey in the region of Izmir, where they grow some of the best quality cotton in the world without GMO’s or synthetic chemicals. It also means that they grow organic foods and use water responsibly to keep in balance with nature.








We’ve collaborated with conscious artists from the around the world to spread our message as wide as possible. The concept of the shirts is "Connect One", and though the artists interpret it differently, it shares the same universal message that we are all interconnected.

Learn more about the artists and stories behind their artwork.








Since 2011, we've visited the organic cotton farms, connected with sustainable producers, and collaborated with international artists and now we have our first 8 sustainable shirts. We're aiming to raise $30,000, and with your help, we’ll be able to run our first production of shirts to make a global impact in the fashion industry!

We believe that we are citizens of the world. We believe we’re not divided by country, but connected by nature. That’s why we create apparel that respects the people who make our clothing and the environment. We believe that by empowering people to be world citizens, we can have a global impact on the fashion industry.

From Denmark to Istanbul, DC to New York, we thank everyone who has helped us on our journey.

Thanks for checking out Connect One Threads. We started this journey in 2011, starting with a final thesis on the sustainability of the clothing supply chain. It evolved into a travel adventure across the US, Europe, and Turkey where we met some and learned from the sustainable fashion movement. It’s been a beautiful journey so far, thanks to the support of so many who believe in what we’re doing, and at the end of the day, we realized this isn’t just for fashion. This is a way for us to come together as a global community.

We’d love for you to be a part of Connect One Threads. We know that the best way to make an impact is to come together, so we invite you to join our group COT Citizens, so that we can share our ideas, help each other out, and create adventures that bring us all together.

Stay connected,
-The COT Crew
